transcript.text: hi and welcome you listening to the x 22

again now i just want to make an

uploaded an interview with john rubino
on the x 22 report spotlight youtube
channel so all you need to do is go over
to youtube type in x 22 report spotlight
will bring you right over to the video
or you can come over to the X when you
report com site scroll down a little bit
look over to your right hand side you
will see the video there or you can go

scroll down a little bit look over the
right hand side you'll see the video
right there let's get right into the
economic collapse financial news now at
this point we're starting to realize
that the economy is not doing what
everyone thinks it's doing we've been
looking at these economic indicators for
quite a while and we've been tracking
each and every one of them and each and
every one of them is declining yes we
might have a dead cat bounce at my bump
up but guess what the trend is down and
you can't really question the facts when
you look at this and say hey the economy
is not doing what the government is
telling us the economy is not doing what
the Fed is telling us we're seeing more
and more corporations lay off people i
mean IBM they have began cutting jobs in
the US and they're also cutting jobs in
canada we see it's happening in Europe
we're seeing it happen in Australia and
globally right now in the year of 2016
this year they're going to be laying off
about 14,000 people Germany is laying
off 900 now we're getting information
that there are more layoffs coming
throughout this year and it looks like
it's going to be happening every quarter
and they have a code name for this it's
called Project solitaire and what we're
seeing is that these companies are being
very very quiet about this remember the
u.s. that the the department that counts
layoffs back in 2013 was discontinued
because of budget
so we look at challenger gray &
christmas to give us the information
about all these companies laying off ed
we're starting to see that things are
starting to ramp up at this point in
time we see BNSF is going to lay off
about 4,600 people nationwide and this
is really spreading because as we go
back to June of 2014 to this point in
time in 2016 we're seeing almost a
million people that have been laid off
and this is continually happening there
are a lot of small companies that are
laying off and there are larger
companies that are laying off there are
retail stores that are laying off and
this is going to continually happen and
once the market completely crashes we're
going to see companies come out of
nowhere and say okay we need to cut our

what we're going to see now when we look

conditions right now they are about what
we saw back in 2009 the labor market
conditions index continues to push to
its weakest since 2009 the nineteen
factor labor market condition shows us
that everything is not awesome and we
know that the US the central bank they
have manipulated lating these numbers
for quite a while they don't count those
people that aren't looking anymore but
still want a job and they just count
them as falling off and even if you're
setting out a resume and you haven't
been on an interview guess what hey
you're out of luck we're not going to
count you if you're working a part-time
job guess what we're just not going to
count you but if you get a part-time job
we count we count you as a full-time job
so we can see how they play around with
all these different numbers and
everything like that and the economy at
this point is declining we're starting
to see everything where they're
downgrading and revising their numbers
they're going back and saying okay yeah
look it looks pretty bad right now and
we're going to have to downgrade our
numbers now we see the Baltic Dry Index
it has moved up a little bit to about
87 this is still very very low compared
to all the other years going back to
1985 and we can see at this point during
a healthy economy we're around 1100 and
what we're seeing right now is a little
bump up and most likely we'll probably
level off and then start heading down
again and we've seen this before many
many times during this portion of the

that manufacturing is going to

the US service sector is going to
decline and right now the US service

slowest pace since the survey began in

that things again are falling apart now
we're going to walk down memory lane

are going on in the economy and we're

factory orders they have declined
year-on-year for 16 months in a row this
sound like a recovery no actually
factory orders right now have reached

that corporate earnings is down
eight-point-five percent and this is
during the first quarter of 2016 this
will be the fourth quarter in a row that
we see year-over-year declines total
business sales have fallen five percent
since the peak in mid-2014 SP 500

gray & christmas they're saying that

up thirty two percent
during the force the first quarter of

consumers have accumulated more new

in the real estate market existing home

because the economy is contracting it's

this is why we see a contraction in GDP
this is why we see a contraction in the

Australia Europe the private western

hundred and two million working-age

now the president can come out and tell

the bridge collapses now all those

there's a little bit more rust this

oh maybe two percent maybe 1.5% and as

they throw in Obamacare where they throw

it's not doing what everyone has been
